Articles.Content: 0-0 is an ocean last time I checked.
0, 0 should take you to the ocean.
Thank you. I just hope my submarine's hull can survive the water. (Need to develop component by component. It's too damn large.)

Hey y'all

I have been playing KSP but mostly taking a break form battles.

Lately I have:

Made a new ISS replica (somewhat)

Made a small space shuttle

Captured my first asteroid.

I ll be back to battle but right now still don't have much of a desire to

In the mean time any body want to try out my shuttle? Its all stock

http://www./view/2c5ri67jd7i9wna/Shuttle_x2.craft

The main challenge is to get the darn submarine to sink

Try making it neutral buoyancy

You're probably running a 32 bit OS and/or 32 bit KSP.

Hey, wow, now that I think about it, that's it. i'm running 32 bit ksp and 32 bit java, despite having 64 bit graphics card. Thanks

*Sigh*, can't wait for good multiplayer

STATUS UPDATE.

Missiles installed, work on revised outer hull is resumed. The length of the submarine is insane, and I lengthened it after taking the picture.

64 bit seems to be working now, even though it was screwed up before.

Edit 2: I've been trying to use KSP for hours to little success. Will try again later. Right now I'm frustrated with it.

I've been trying to use KSP for hours to little success. Will try again later. Right now I'm frustrated with it.

It happens. I just take a break for a short bit (hours to a day or two) and then try again later.

Also... due to certain range issues with my fancy 'ol XD-X VTOL fighter, I've made a 2-seater companion that might be much better...

It's called the (creatively enough) XD-Y Spectre. Any guess which IRL aircraft it's based (loosely) off of?

EDIT:

I got the Spectre working as a fighter-bomber.

[battle break mode on]

Just passing bye because this answer bugged me since a few day.

In fact the right translation is:

"Here I sit and dream, to tender rhyme."

Why:

simply because there a "multilinguistic meaning & phonetics mirror": sit and dream = si tendre rime [phoenetics] = s'asseoir et rever [meaning].

(Also notice it's a 12 feet alexandrine, with 6 feet cut as anecdot)

In fact i was doing this kind of things 15 years ago, i now do some similar ones sometimes a few more elaborated and sometime less.

Alright, sounds good. Once I set the first one up I was already thinking it would take too long and this is better. I might have been carried away and wanted to test out all of my ships in one battle...

On another note, I also made a VTOL but I can't see what the big deal is since I can't pilot them well at all. Do all of you have joysticks for piloting?

I don't, I think they're nasty little things. I have a nice, balanced VTOL if you'd like to learn how to fly one.

You can download it here.

Edited August 4, 2014 by Megalodon 720
Broken link.

So... considering some people are getting into air-to-air combat (looking at you, Zekes), or at least practicing it, I decided to see if it was possible.

*My Plane: MU XD-Y Spectre outfitted with 2 IBeam missiles and 2 guided missiles*

*Target Plane: VL Renegade, outfitted with 6 small rockets* (Sorry I had to shoot down your plane there, Fleet. It just was a good target drone for the test.)

Javascript is disabled. View full album

So I now can say I've shot down another ship in air-to-air fighting.

Alright, sounds good. Once I set the first one up I was already thinking it would take too long and this is better. I might have been carried away and wanted to test out all of my ships in one battle...

On another note, I also made a VTOL but I can't see what the big deal is since I can't pilot them well at all. Do all of you have joysticks for piloting?

Nah, I just fly 'em slowly and carefully. Using precise control (caps lock) helps, as does leaving SAS on 24/7 whilst in VTOL mode. You also might want to check how the fuel drains while flying/hovering, as that can heavily affect VTOL performance.

I've got another VTOL...

The MT-18 Vulture is fully armed and operational.

Live-Fire testing:

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Looks vulnerable, the engines could easily be blown off which would unbalance the craft.

Looks vulnerable, the engines could easily be blown off which would unbalance the craft.

Trust me, it's tougher than it looks. I crashed it at over 30m/s, destroying a chunk of the nose and the payload bay, and it still flew.

The engines are mounted on steel beams, not the actual wings.
I like it. Personally I don't know how they're better than VTOL fighters.

I like it. Personally I don't know how they're better than VTOL fighters.

It's sorta like how IRL helicopters (and the poorly-flown V22 Osprey) can do certain things that VTOL fighters (which there aren't too many of IRL) aren't built OR meant to do.

The MT-18 fills the role of a heavily-armed short-to-mid range gunship/troop-and-cargo carrier, and a persistent air support platform.
I think we need this old bird back:

I think we need this old bird back:

http://www.electricitybook.com/spherical-flying-machine/harrier-jump-jet.jpg

On it, I'll go ask iDan real quick.
